intro: Eleocharis septata, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a member of the Cyperaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant that typically grows in wetland environments such as marshes, ponds, and along the edges of water bodies. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that contain tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Its rhizomes help it spread and establish dense colonies in moist soils. Eleocharis septata plays an important ecological role by stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
